formattedAddress: 240 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 240 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: My first visited in NY over 10years ago. I was fall in love this store/products and customer service. But, I was disappointed with the customer service at Clare V now.While I love the brand, the store associate lacked friendliness and didn’t exchange greetings, making the experience less pleasant. It seems more training in customer service skills is needed.

text.text: My first visited in NY over 10years ago. I was fall in love this store/products and customer service. It seems more training in customer service skills is needed.

originalText.text: Can only comment on staff/ service. I had bought my girlfriend a Claire V necklace online, but came in to see if they could give me a small box to make for nicer presentation of the gift. Not only did Kelsey happily do that she also gave me nice paper, ribbon etc that I used to wrap. Previous reviews had me nervous, esp since I wasn’t buying anything thy day, but she was great.

originalText.text: The low stars are for the location not the product. I love Clare V. as a brand. Like the other low reviews for this location the staff isn’t terribly friendly. There’s now a buzzer you need to push to get in that either doesn’t work or the associates don’t seem to know how to use. I’ve been twice and not been able to get into the store and completely ignored by the associates standing at the counter.

text.text: The low stars are for the location not the product. I love Clare V. as a brand. Like the other low reviews for this location the staff isn’t terribly friendly. There’s now a buzzer you need to push to get in that either doesn’t work or the associates don’t seem to know how to use. originalText.text:
I'm visiting NYC from Minneapolis and I always make a point to stop by,  as Clare V is from Minnesota and I am a long-time fan and customer.
After about 20 minutes of looking, I was ready to buy two bags, some accessories, and a sweatshirt. I hadn't been acknowledged or greeted by either of the two people working, and when I asked a question was brushed off and then given a cold reply. I was really disappointed and was kind of made to feel like a nobody. This is such a bummer not only because I was going to drop big dollars there, but knowing that the designer has roots in the midwest, I would have expected a much friendlier and welcoming experience.

After about 20 minutes of looking, I was ready to buy two bags, some accessories, and a sweatshirt. I was really disappointed and was kind of made to feel like a nobody. This is such a bummer not only because I was going to drop big dollars there, but knowing that the designer has roots in the midwest, I would have expected a much friendlier and welcoming experience.

originalText.text:
Excellent products. I was impressed by the quality of the goods. The product's are branded like Michael Kors and the like, so they make a great gift for those ladies that have expensive tastes but don't want to let everybody know about it.

The woman helping me (either the manager or owner) wasn't very warm and while she was helpful and excited to sell and wrap the bag for me, it was hard to connect. This only slightly took away from my experience in the store, thus 4 stars.
